docs.title: Job Portal Application Documentation
docs.text:
This documentation provides a detailed overview of the project’s functional and business use cases, system design, user roles, and workflows.

The Job Portal App is built using the MERN stack and designed as a Progressive Web Application (PWA) to give users a installable experience similar to a native mobile app.

docs.title: About the Project
docs.text: The Job Portal App is developed to bridge the gap between students (job seekers) and recruiters (employers). It helps recruiters manage job postings and applications efficiently while giving students a simple way to find, apply, and track job opportunities.

docs.title: Business Use Cases
docs.text:
This section explains the main business use cases of the Job Portal App. Each use case represents how students and recruiters interact with the system in real-world scenarios.

# Business Use Case Description Stakeholders 1 Recruiters manage job postings Recruiters can create, edit, and delete job listings. Recruiters 2 Students apply for jobs Students browse job listings and apply with a resume and cover letter. Students 3 Application review and decision Recruiters review applications and update status (accept/reject). Recruiters, Students 4 Profile management Students maintain updated resumes, skills, and contact info. Students 5 Job discovery Students can search and filter jobs by title, company, or location. Students 6 Secure role-based system Authentication and authorization to ensure correct access control. All users 7 Transparency in hiring Students can see job status updates ("Pending", “Under Review”, "Interview Scheduled", "Hired", “Rejected”). Students

docs.title: Future Scope
docs.text: The Job Portal App can be expanded with more advanced and industry-level features to make it more intelligent, scalable, and user-friendly.

docs.title: Possible Future Enhancements
docs.text:
1. Meeting Scheduling Feature: Meeting can be Scheduled between students and recruiters.

  2. AI-Based Job Recommendations: Suggests jobs to students based on their profile, resume, and application history.

  3. Resume Parsing and Analysis: Automatically extracts keywords from uploaded resumes to match with recruiter job requirements.

  4. Email & SMS Notifications: Sends automatic alerts to users when job status changes or new matching jobs are available.

  5. Payment or Subscription Module: Allows premium recruiters to highlight their job posts or access special features.

These features will make the platform more robust, intelligent, and closer to real-world job portals like LinkedIn or Indeed.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The Job Portal App is a modern web-based application that connects students who are actively seeking jobs or internships with recruiters offering employment opportunities. It aims to make recruitment more organized, faster, and transparent for both sides.

docs.title: Problem Statement
docs.text:
The traditional recruitment process often involves lengthy communication, multiple applications, and unclear status tracking. Students face difficulty knowing whether they are selected or rejected, and recruiters find it challenging to manage a large number of applicants manually.

This project solves these issues by providing a centralized platform where: - Students can easily browse and apply for jobs. - Recruiters can efficiently manage job postings and applications. - Both parties can communicate through a single, structured system.

docs.title: How It Simplifies the Process
docs.text:
The Job Portal App simplifies the entire hiring workflow by offering: - Centralized job listings: All available jobs are displayed in one place. - Role-based access: Recruiters and students have separate dashboards and permissions. - Application tracking: Students can see their job application status (Pending, Under Review, Interview Scheduled, Hired or Rejected) in real-time. - Data security: Authentication ensures that user data and applications remain secure.

This system makes job management convenient and provides a professional, digital experience for both recruiters and applicants.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
The main purpose of this project is to simplify and automate the recruitment process between students and recruiters. It provides a platform that eliminates manual communication and creates an efficient, transparent process for applying and hiring.

The system ensures: - Faster communication between job seekers and recruiters. - Centralized data storage for all job and application records. - Secure and easy management of user data and job listings.

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text:
• Frontend: React.js, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (with Vite and TailwindCSS for styling)
  • Backend: Node.js, Express.js
  • Database: MongoDB (Cloud via MongoDB Atlas)
  • Authentication: JWT (JSON Web Token) based role management
  • Hosting: Vercel (Frontend) and Render (Backend)
  • Version Control: Git & GitHub for branch-based development

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Secure Authentication: Only verified users can log in and perform specific actions.
  • Authorization: Role-based permissions for students and recruiters.
  • Recruiter Dashboard: Allows job posting, editing, and managing applicants.
  • Student Dashboard: Enables job browsing, applying, and profile management.
  • Resume Upload: Students can upload and update resumes anytime.
  • Application Tracking: Recruiters can update application status, and students can view statuses.
  • Responsive Design: Works smoothly across all devices.

docs.title: Project Highlights
docs.text:
This project demonstrates how real-world job portals work using the MERN stack. It includes complete CRUD functionality, API integration, and database relationships between users, jobs, and applications.

It also serves as a base project that can be further extended to include: - Admin dashboards - Notification systems - Job recommendations using AI

docs.title: System Architecture
docs.text:
This page shows the system architecture of the Job Portal App.

The architecture mainly focuses on providing a scalable and secure environment using AWS and cloud-based services.

docs.title: 🧩 Explanation
docs.text:
• Frontend (React + Vite): The user interface is built using React website.

  • Backend (Node.js + Express): The backend is deployed on an AWS EC2 instance inside a VPC (Virtual Private Cloud).

  • Database (MongoDB Atlas): Stores all user, job, company, bookmarks and application data securely in the cloud.

  • File Storage (AWS S3): Used to store uploaded files like resumes and profile photos.

  • Security: Authentication and Authorization are implemented using JWT tokens, ensuring only verified users can access protected routes.

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text: This page outlines the chosen technology stack for the Job Portal Application, along with the stable versions.

docs.title: Frontend
docs.text:
• React + Vite (v19.2.0 / v7.2): Provides fast UI rendering and hot module replacement for rapid development.
  • Redux (v5.0.1): Manages global state across different components.
  • Tailwind CSS (v4.1.13): Used for responsive and modern design.
  • Shadcn/ui (v0.9.5): Customizable component library used for accessible UI components (like modals, dropdowns, buttons, and inputs).

docs.title: Backend
docs.text:
• Node.js (v24.x): Provides a runtime environment for server-side logic.
  • Express.js (v5.1.0): Handles API routes and middleware logic.
  • JWT Authentication (v9.0.2): Ensures secure login and role-based route protection.

docs.title: Database
docs.text: • MongoDB (8.0.): Stores users, jobs, and applications. Each recruiter’s jobs and corresponding applications are linked via object references.

docs.title: File Storage
docs.text: • AWS S3 (v33.902.0 AWS SDK): Stores resume files and photos like company logo and user profile photo.

docs.title: User Roles
docs.text: In this application, there are two main roles: Student and Recruiter. Each role has specific features and permissions that define what they can do inside the system.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Students are job seekers who use this platform to explore and apply for job opportunities.

docs.title: Main Functionalities:
docs.text:
• Account Access: Create an account or log in securely.
  • View Jobs: Access all active job listings posted by recruiters.
  • Search Jobs: Search for jobs by title, company, or location.
  • View Job Details: See full job information before applying.
  • Apply for Jobs: Submit an application and upload a resume.
  • Profile Management: Update resume, skills, and personal information.
  • Track Applications: View all applied jobs with status updates like Pending, Under Review, Interview Scheduled, Hired or Rejected.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: Recruiters are users responsible for posting jobs and managing student applications.

docs.title: Main Functionalities:
docs.text:
• Account Access: Login or register securely as a recruiter.
  • Post Jobs: Create new job listings with required details.
  • Edit or Delete Jobs: Modify or remove previously posted jobs.
  • View Applicants: See a list of all students who applied to their jobs.
  • Resume Review: Access student resumes directly through the dashboard.
  • Updating Application Status: Update the application status for each applicant.
  • Manage Posted Jobs: View all their active job posts in one dashboard.

This clear role separation ensures data privacy, secure access, and a smooth experience for both types of users.

docs.title: Workflow
docs.text: This section explains how the system works for both Students and Recruiters, showing the main flow of actions step-by-step.

docs.title: Student Workflow
docs.text:
1. Registration / Login: The student creates an account or logs in securely.

  2. Browse Jobs: Once logged in, they can view all available job posts listed by recruiters.

  3. Search Job: Students can search for specific jobs based on keywords.

  4. Job Detail Page: Students can visit job detail page for detail information of particular job.

  5. Apply for a Job: After visiting job detail page, students can apply for the job.

  6. Profile Management: Students can update their skills and resume anytime through their profile section.

  7. Track Application Status: After applying, the student can view the job application status as Pending, Under Review, Interview Scheduled, Hired or Rejected.

docs.title: Recruiter Workflow
docs.text:
1. Registration / Login: Recruiter signs up or logs in securely.

  2. Post Job: Recruiter creates a new job post with details like title, description, experience, and location.

  3. Manage Jobs: Recruiter can edit or delete their posted jobs at any time.

  4. View Applicants: The system lists all students who have applied for each job post.

  5. Review Applications: Recruiter checks resumes and decides the states of the application.

  6. Status Update: Recruiter updates the application status, and the student can view it in their dashboard.

This workflow ensures both users interact smoothly and have clear visibility of all actions taken throughout the recruitment process.
